IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: CHARLOTTE COUNTRY DAY SCHOOL PROVIDES COMPREHENSIVE EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS FOR GRADES PRE-KINDERGARTEN THROUGH GRADE 12 ON A NON-DISCRIMINATORY BASIS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THROUGH EXCELLENCE IN EDUCATION, CHARLOTTE COUNTRY DAY SCHOOL DEVELOPS THE POTENTIAL OF EACH STUDENT BY FOSTERING INTELLECTUAL CURIOSITY, PRINCIPLED CHARACTER, ETHICAL LEADERSHIP AND A RESPONSIBILITY TO SERVE. THE KEY VALUES AND COMMITMENTS ARE EDUCATIONAL EXCELLENCE, CHARACTER, COMMUNITY, AND SERVICE.
IRS990.Desc: INSTRUCTIONAL - FUNDS WERE USED TO PROVIDE COMPREHENSIVE EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS TO APPROXIMATELY 1,742 STUDENTS IN GRADES PRE-KINDERGARTEN THROUGH GRADE 12.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: SPECIAL PROGRAM FEES - FUNDS WERE USED TO PROVIDE SPECIAL PROGRAMS, INCLUDING AFTER-SCHOOL CARE, AFTER-SCHOOL ENRICHMENT CLASSES, TUTORING, AND SUMMER DAY CAMPS (SPORTS, ARTS, ENRICHMENT) TO CHILDREN IN GRADES PRE-KINDERGARTEN THROUGH GRADE 12.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: AUXILIARY SERVICES - FUNDS WERE USED TO PROVIDE FOOD, CAMPUS STORE, AND TRANSPORTATION TO STUDENTS IN GRADES PRE-KINDERGARTEN THROUGH GRADE 12. BEGINNING IN JULY 2022, THESE EXPENSES ALSO INCLUDED COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH OPERATING AND MAINTAINING THE DONATED WEDDINGTON FARM PROPERTY.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.TitleTxt: HEAD OF SCHOOL AS OF JULY 1, 2022

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE USED FOR SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID, FACULTY AND STAFF SUPPORT, CURRICULUM AND PROGRAM SUPPORT AND GENERAL OPERATING EXPENSES, SUCH AS CAMPUS AND FACILITY MAINTENANCE. THE PERCENTAGE REPORTED FOR PERMANENT ENDOWMENTS INCLUDES AMOUNTS THAT MUST BE MAINTAINED IN PERPETUITY AS WELL AS ACCUMULATED EARNINGS ON SUCH AMOUNTS THAT HAVE NOT YET BEEN APPROPRIATED FOR EXPENDITURE.

COUNTRY DAY IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAX AND APPLICABLE STATE STATUTES UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE (IRC). ACCORDINGLY, NO PROVISION HAS BEEN MADE FOR INCOME TAXES IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. IN ACCORDANCE WITH IRC REGULATIONS, COUNTRY DAY IS TAXED ON UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME, WHICH CONSISTS OF EARNINGS FROM ACTIVITIES NOT RELATED TO THE EXEMPT PURPOSE OF THE SCHOOL. MANAGEMENT HAS EVALUATED THE EFFECT OF GUIDANCE SURROUNDING UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AND CONCLUDED THAT COUNTRY DAY HAD NO SIGNIFICANT FINANCIAL STATEMENT EXPOSURE TO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AT JUNE 30, 2023.
FINANCIAL AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS SHOWN NET OF TUITION ON FINANCIALS -3,948,667. CHANGE IN FAIR VALUE OF LIABILITY UNDER INTEREST RATE SWAP 439,892.
SPECIAL EVENT AND GAMING EXPENSES -374,603. COST OF GOODS SOLD -292,630. LOSS ON DISPOSAL OF FIXED ASSETS -155,075.
COST OF GOODS SOLD 292,630. SPECIAL EVENT AND GAMING EXPENSES 374,603. LOSS ON DISPOSAL OF FIXED ASSETS 155,075.
FINANCIAL AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS SHOWN NET OF TUITION ON FINANCIALS 3,948,667.

THE SCHOOL'S RACIALLY NON-DISCRIMINATORY POLICY TOWARDS STUDENTS IS PUBLISHED THROUGH A PRINTED STATEMENT OF THE SCHOOL'S ADMINISTRATION POLICY IN A LOCAL NEWSPAPER AND MAGAZINES AS WELL AS ON THE SCHOOL'S WEBSITE.

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.RegionTxt: CENTRAL AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN - ANTIGUA & BARBUDA, ARUBA, BAHAMAS,

INTERNATIONAL STUDIES ENGLAND CREATIVES ARTS AND CULTURAL EXCHANGE, ICELAND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE EXPERIENCE, ITALY ARTS EXPERIENCE, ITALY RENAISSANCE EXPERIENCE, SCOTLAND THEATER ARTS EXPERIENCE, SISTER CITIES OF EUROPE (POLAND, GERMANY, AND FRANCE) PEOPLE-TO-PEOPLE EXPERIENCE, AND SPAIN/MOROCCO LANGUAGE IMMERSION EXPERIENCE

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.RegionTxt: CENTRAL AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN - ANTIGUA & BARBUDA, ARUBA, BAHAMAS,

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE AMOUNT REPORTED IN PART I REPRESENTS THE FAIR MARKET VALUE OF INVESTMENTS AS OF THE END OF THE TAX YEAR.
AMOUNTS REPORTED FOR EXPENDITURES IN PART I HAVE BEEN CALCULATED USING THE ACCRUAL METHOD OF ACCOUNTING.

THE AMOUNT OF THE FINANCIAL AID OR SCHOLARSHIP IS ONLY APPLIED TO A STUDENTS' BILLING ACCOUNT. THE FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE REVIEWS ALL REQUESTS FOR FINANCIAL AID. ADDITIONALLY, EACH DONOR (OF A NAMED SCHOLARSHIP ENDOWMENT) RECEIVES A LETTER FROM DEVELOPMENT SAYING WHO RECEIVED THE SCHOLARSHIP. THE SUPPORT AWARDED IS BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED.

RltdOrgOfficerTrstKeyEmplGrp.TitleTxt: HEAD OF SCHOOL AS OF JULY 1, 2022

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD APPROVED THAT THE HEAD OF SCHOOL MAY TRAVEL FIRST-CLASS. THE BOARD ALSO APPROVED THAT THE HEAD OF SCHOOL IS ALLOWED A BUDGETED AMOUNT OF DISCRETIONARY EXPENDITURES. IT IS USED TO SUPPORT ANY UNANTICIPATED NEEDS OF THE SCHOOL. AS A CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT, THE HEAD OF SCHOOL IS REQUIRED TO LIVE IN A HOUSE OWNED BY THE SCHOOL, WHICH IS ADJACENT TO THE CANNON CAMPUS PROPERTY. THIS RESIDENCE IS PROVIDED FOR THE CONVENIENCE OF THE SCHOOL IN HAVING THE FUNCTIONS OF THE OFFICE OF THE HEAD OF SCHOOL EFFICIENTLY DISCHARGED. THE SCHOOL PROVIDES HOUSEKEEPING SERVICES TO THE HEAD OF SCHOOL FOR THE CONVENIENCE OF THE EMPLOYER SO THAT THE HEAD OF SCHOOL CAN PERFORM ESSENTIAL SCHOOL BUSINESS AND ACTIVITIES AT THE HOME. THIS HOUSING ALLOWANCE IS TREATED AS A NON-TAXABLE BENEFIT. ANY BONUS OR TAXABLE FRINGE BENEFIT THAT IS GROSSED UP FOR TAX PURPOSES IS ALSO TREATED AS TAXABLE COMPENSATION.
CERTAIN EMPLOYEES RECEIVED BONUSES DUE TO TAKING ON ADDITIONAL DUTIES IN ASSISTING THE INTERIM HOS AND OTHER PERFORMANCE ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS.

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: REFUND PRIOR ISSUE AND SCHOOL FACILITY IMPROVEMENTS

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FINANCE COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE IRS FORM 990 WITH THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER BEFORE THE FORM IS FILED. THE IRS FORM 990 IS THEN PROVIDED TO BOARD MEMBERS PRIOR TO FILING. MEMBERS ARE ENCOURAGED TO REVIEW THE FORM AND DIRECT ANY QUESTIONS TO THE CHAIR OF THE FINANCE COMMITTEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD MAINTAINS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY WHICH IS REVIEWED AND SIGNED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. ALL TRUSTEES AND OTHER INTERESTED PERSONS ARE REQUIRED TO READ, COMPLETE AND SIGN THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY FORM ANNUALLY. IF AN ISSUE IS TO BE DECIDED BY THE BOARD THAT INVOLVES A POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST FOR A BOARD MEMBER OR OTHER INTERESTED PERSONS, IT IS THE RESPONSIBILITY OF THE BOARD MEMBER OR OTHER INTERESTED PERSONS TO: (1) IDENTIFY THE POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST SO THAT BOARD MEMBERS WHO ARE VOTING ON A DECISION ARE AWARE THAT ANOTHER MEMBERS' INTEREST ARE BEING AFFECTED; (2) NOT PARTICIPATE IN THE DISCUSSION OF THE PROGRAM, ISSUE OR MOTION BEING CONSIDERED; AND (3) BE RECUSED DURING THE VOTE ON THE MOTION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL HAS A HEAD'S COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. THE COMMITTEE ANNUALLY REVIEWS BENCHMARK COMPENSATION DATA FROM SEVERAL SOURCES SUCH AS NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS (NAIS) AND INDEPENDENT SCHOOL DATA EXCHANGE (INDEX). THE COMMITTEE ANALYZES DATA FROM THESE AND OTHER ORGANIZATIONS IN ORDER TO MAKE A RECOMMENDATION TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES REGARDING THE HEAD'S COMPENSATION. THE BOARD HAS APPROVAL AUTHORITY FOR THE HEAD'S COMPENSATION AND THE DECISION IS DOCUMENTED ANNUALLY. THE HEAD OF SCHOOL DETERMINES AND ESTABLISHES SALARIES FOR ALL OTHER TOP MANAGEMENT AND KEY EMPLOYEES. HE USES DATA FROM THESE SAME ORGANIZATIONS (NAIS & INDEX) TO ASSIST IN ESTABLISHING TOP MANAGEMENT AND KEY EMPLOYEE SALARIES. ALL SALARY INCREASES MUST BE WITHIN THE BUDGET AS APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, AND THE BOARD MONITORS THE BUDGET TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
